qas.question: What was the abacus first used for?
When was the Roman abacus first used?
Where was the Roman abacus first used?
In medieval Europe was was placed on a table to help count money?
A checkered cloth on a table was used in medieval Europe to help count what?

context: The abacus was initially used for <a0_0>arithmetic tasks<a0_0/>. The Roman abacus was used in <a2_0>Babylonia<a2_0/> as early as <a1_0>2400 BC<a1_0/>. Since then, many other forms of reckoning boards or tables have been invented. In a medieval European counting house, <a3_0>a checkered cloth<a3_0/> would be placed on a table, and markers moved around on it according to certain rules, as an aid to calculating <a4_0>sums of money<a4_0/>.
